textPlain: If there hadn’t been any cases of human infection in 30 years, can this really be explained by the cattle smuggling? Feels like something else must have changed too.
Worms turn into flies which lay eggs in wounds that spawn more worms in a few days. Not great.
They mention cattle illegaly raised in nature reserves. There may have been some surviving population of flies there.
Hey, I think I've seen that movie.
Another thing is the the stories in this article. They left me with a horror. Not great.
